meanings.definition: A chronic skin condition characterized by redness and visible blood vessels on the face.
meanings.sent1: Her rosacea made her cheeks look red and her skin sensitive.
meanings.sent2: The dermatologist diagnosed her with rosacea after noticing the redness on her face.
meanings.sent3: Even though she tried to cover it up with makeup, her rosacea always peeked through.
meanings.sent4: To her, rosacea felt like a constant spotlight shining on her face.
meanings.sent5: The rosacea on her face was like a permanent blush that never faded.

meanings.definition: A condition that causes small, red, pus-filled bumps on the skin.
meanings.sent1: The rosacea on his skin made him self-conscious about his appearance.
meanings.sent2: She applied a soothing cream to calm the rosacea on her cheeks.
meanings.sent3: His rosacea acted up whenever he was stressed, creating a bumpy texture on his skin.
meanings.sent4: The red bumps of rosacea seemed to multiply overnight, surprising him each morning.
meanings.sent5: The rosacea bumps felt like tiny volcanoes erupting on his face.

meanings.definition: A disorder that can cause the nose to become swollen and bumpy.
meanings.sent1: Her rosacea affected not only her cheeks but also caused her nose to swell.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained that the bumpy nose was a result of her rosacea.
meanings.sent3: His rosacea made his nose look like a small, red mountain on his face.
meanings.sent4: The swollen nose from rosacea made it difficult for her to wear glasses comfortably.
meanings.sent5: The bumpy nose caused by rosacea felt like a constant reminder of her skin condition.
